title: Enabling a More Circular Future for Medtech Packaging - MD+DI
summary: The article discusses sustainability initiatives in healthcare packaging focusing on increasing the circularity of healthcare plastics through innovative design, material selection, and recycling technologies.

title: Do deposits decrease beverage sales? Study says no - Plastics Recycling Update
summary: The study indicates that there is no decrease in sales with the adoption or expansion of container deposit return systems, attributing any fluctuations to various factors such as changing economic conditions and labeling adjustments.

green_process: FALSE, The article discusses the effects of deposit return systems on beverage sales, but does not delve into specific methods or techniques within manufacturing or operational activities.
greenwashing: FALSE, The study provides data on the impact of deposit return systems on beverage sales, with no indication of false or misleading environmental claims.

title: Finat reveals whitepaper on self-adhesive labels - Labels and Labeling
summary: The article discusses the importance of using specific self-adhesive labels in PET recycling to ensure clean PET flakes for closed-loop recycling.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as it focuses on improving recycling processes and reducing environmental impact through innovative label technology.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article highlights the development of new self-adhesive label technologies for PET recycling, demonstrating a business innovation in the packaging industry.
